name: Leverton House

reviews.text: I have stayed in different guest houses in Cambridge over a period of eight years . I opted for Leverton House this year and I certainly " hit the jackpot" It was superior to any I have stayed in. I have no hesitation in recommending this establishment.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS LOVELY BnB
Definitely A Place To Return To

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have been more pleased with the room (very un-b and b like with absolutely no chintz - even a flat-screen TV in the room!) and the service was topnotch. Wendy is a lovely host and keeps everything spotless. Breakfast is organic and made to order and as a very picky coffee-drinker, the coffee was first-rate.
reviews.title: Beautiful house and lovely host

reviews.text: Don't be put off by the distance from town - the bus stop is right outside the BnB and you're in town in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: It is the BEST in the UK !

likes.disliked: — ummm nothing I think it is a perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were visiting family in nearby Waterbeach and found this B&B on this website. Upon arrival, we were very impressed with the friendly and efficient host, Wendy. The room we were shown to was very well decorated and absolutely spotlessly clean! Everything felt very fresh and new. Tea and coffee making facilities were good with biscuits and even Ovaltine to warm us up on the wintry night!
reviews.title: Very welcoming B&B and host

likes.liked: — How clean it was and the friendly host!

reviews.text: Breakfast the following morning was delicious and well-prepared and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: truely lovely n big fish in the pond

likes.liked: — sweet n clean n friendly n nice

reviews.text: Although we did not go into Cambridge itself, it was clear that access to the city would be very easy from Leverton House. There is a Park & Ride just down the road, and the B&B is on a bus route into town.
reviews.title: fab

reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in recommending this B&B to visitors to Cambridge. We will certainly be booking in again next time we visit our family.
reviews.title: A great stay
The Perfect B&B!
reviews.text: a bit of a late review, but it was lovely, cleanest place we'd ever stayed and real staffordshire pottery plates at breakfast. lovely and highly recommended

I had a wonderful and great time here. I felt really comfortable and personal. The rooms are extra clean and everywhere is a great fragrance. Wendy and Andy are so lovely people. They are extremly friendly and hospitable people. I´m so sad that I can´t stay longer (than 5 weeks). Thanks a lot for everything! Best wishes your german girl Marika :)!
reviews.title: My second feel at home

reviews.text: We are two Italians currently working in a Guest House in Brighton&Hove. We decided to spend a couple of days away mainly to relax and visiting a new city. Wendy, the lovely hostess, gave us all the instructions to get to her place, despite of this - and it wasn t her fault,of course! - we got off in the wrong place and she came over to pick us up with her car: we didn t expect such a warm welcome! This new, 4stars b&b is just 10 minutes by bus off the city centre as well as the airport, and smells fresh and clean since you get in. No doubts: it is family run, with all their love. Biscuits, Tea and coffee facilities in the room are a nice touch. En suite bathroom very clean, too. English Breakfast freshly cooked by Wendy - but we chose the continental one,ahh these Italians so traditional... - juices, milk, fresh fruits, cereals, wide selection of yogurts and jams...we were full up in a few minutes.
reviews.title: Everybody feels at home at Leverton House!

reviews.text: After a day's visiting in Cambridge we spent a wonderfully relaxing night at Leverton House. Wendy made us feel very welcome and catered to all our needs. We were pleased to have a family room and much appreciated the tea making facilities plus biscuits, the good beds as well as the on-suite shower room (well working shower! - not always available in the UK ...). The room was well insulated, spotlessly clean and freshly decorated. We also enjoyed the generous and varied breakfast and marvelled at the fact that Wendy managed to serve a cooked breakfast that felt light.
reviews.title: Wonderfully welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend a lovely valentine's weekend in this amazing bed and breakfast. When we arrived we were nicely surprised by a bottle of (really good) champagne and a box of chocolates because the room that Wendy wanted to put us in wasnt available so she put us in another room. Well, I haven't seen the room that we were supposed to be in, but our room and bathroom was perfect as well! A Laura Ashley kind of style and really good beds! The breakfast is really nice as well, and lastly, what can we say about Wendy, she's just the best person to run a B&B, she makes you feel at home straight away and does everything to make you feel at ease. Rodrigo and Leonie
reviews.title: Homely and Relaxing

reviews.text: My daughter and I decided to visit Cambridge for my birthday. Luckily we found the Leverton and Wendy...what a wonderful place to stay as a base. Wendy is such a lovely lady and the rooms were spotless, comfortable and the breakfast delicious (especially the poached eggs). My daughter and I were making our own separate ways to the Leverton, I arrived first and Wendy kindly offered to pick my daughter up from the bus stop which was really appreciated. Also, what a lovely personal touch as when arriving back one evening, I found a birthday card with a pressie Wendy had left in the room for me. I can honestly say that staying at the Leverton made our stay in Cambridge all the more enjoyable, I wish I could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: A delightful Gem with a wonderfully warm welcolme

reviews.text: Very welcoming. Room was spotless and very comfortable and the breakfast was great. I got the impression that Wendy couldn't do enough for you. Very happy.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with several reviewers, we were staying to visit family in Cambridge, and found this B&B to be wonderful. Wendy was so welcoming, the room spotless and comfortable, and an excellent breakfast. We would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

description: We pride ourselves on our clean and comfortable rooms and friendly service. All our rooms are non-smoking and have color TVs, tea and coffee making facilities and hairdryers. We also provide a patio area at the end of a pleasant garden, and off-road parking. We are located a mile and a half east of Cambridge City Centre on the A1303 (Newmarket Road) which is easily accessible from the M11 via the A14.
